item.inventory

Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • item.inventory.Inventory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MovableEffect
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PlayerInventory, SquareInventory

    public abstract class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
implements MovableEffect
    Inventory class is used to contain items
    Author:
    Dieter Castel, Jonas Devlieghere, Vincent Reniers en Stefan Pante

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Inventory()
      Creates a new instance of the Inventory class with unlimited size.
      Inventory(double size)
      Creates a new instance of the Inventory class with given size.

      • Inventory

        @Raw
public Inventory(double size)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new instance of the Inventory class with given size.
        Parameters:
        size - The size of the new inventory.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the given size is invalid.

      • Inventory

        public Inventory()
        Creates a new instance of the Inventory class with unlimited size.

    • Method Detail

      • isValidMaximumSize

        public static boolean isValidMaximumSize(double size)
        Checks if the given size is valid for this inventory.
        Parameters:
        size - The size to check.
        Returns:
        True if the size is larger or equal to zero. False otherwise.

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Checks if the inventory is full.
        Returns:
        False If the inventory is not full after adding the item. True If the inventory is already at its maximum capacity.

      • isEmpty

        @Basic
public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks if the inventory is empty.
        Returns:
        True if the inventory is empty, False otherwise.

      • getMaximumSize

        @Basic
public double getMaximumSize()
        The maximum size of this inventory of items.
        Returns:
        An integer representing the maximum size of this inventory.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns the size of already occupied spaces in the inventory.
        Returns:
        An integer representing the spaces already occupied in this inventory.

      • getAllItems

        public java.util.ArrayList<Item> getAllItems()
        Returns all the items.

      • hasItem

        public boolean hasItem(Item item)
        checks if the given item is in the inventory
        Parameters:
        item - the item to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the item is contained in this inventory, otherwise false

      • addItem

        public void addItem(Item item)
             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Adds an item to the inventory if the size limit allows it
        Parameters:
        item - the item to be added to the inventory
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - thrown when adding the item would exceed the size of the inventory or the item is already in the inventory

      • isValidItem

        public static boolean isValidItem(Item item)
        Returns whether the given item is a valid item for all Inventory objects.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if and only if the item is not null.

      • canHaveAsItem

        public boolean canHaveAsItem(Item item)
        Checks if a certain item can be added.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to be checked.
        Returns:
        True If the item is not already contained and inventory is not full. False If the item is already contained or the inventory is full.

      • removeItem

        public void removeItem(Item item)
                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Removes a given item from the inventory
        Parameters:
        item - the item to be removed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown when the item cannot be removed, because it is not inside the inventory

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this Inventory object, can be used so that a player can chose the item he wants

        toString in class java.lang.Object
